fr.upmc.components.connectors

Interface TwoWayConnectorI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComponentImplementedI, ConnectorI, OfferedI, java.rmi.Remote, RequiredI, TwoWayI
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DataTwoWayConnectorI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataTwoWayConnector, AbstractTwoWayConnector, DataTwoWayConnector, PairedGaugeConnector

    public interface TwoWayConnectorI
extends ConnectorI, TwoWayI
    The interface TwoWayConnectorI is the generic interface for connectors that mediate between components exposing two-way interfaces.

    Description

    Two-way interfaces are the ones that are used to interconnect components in a peer-to-peer way to exchange services or data. In this case, both components expose the same interface

    Invariant

     invariant      true

    Created on : 2012-01-23

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void connectServer(OfferedI offering, RequiredI requiring)
      connect a requiring component to a requiring one, taking care only of the server port (when the client-side is remote).
      void disconnectServer()
      disconnect a requiring component from an offering one, taking care only of the server port (when the client-side is remote).
      void reconnectServer(OfferedI offering, RequiredI requiring)
      disconnect and connect anew a requiring component to an offering one, taking care only of the server port (when the client-side is remote).

      • Methods inherited from interface fr.upmc.components.connectors.ConnectorI

        connect, connectClient, connected, disconnect, disconnectClient, isRemote, obeyConnection, obeyDisconnection, reconnect, reconnectClient, setRemote

    • Method Detail

      • connectServer

        void connectServer(OfferedI offering,
                 RequiredI requiring)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        connect a requiring component to a requiring one, taking care only of the server port (when the client-side is remote).

        Contract

         pre    offering != null && requiring != null
 pre    offering instanceof TwoWayI
 pre    requiring instanceof TwoWayI
 pre    !this.connected()
 post   ((PortI) offering).connected()
        Parameters:
        offering - in port of the component implementing the offered interface.
        requiring - out port of the component requiring the required interface.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
